oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill of purchase documents from the Commissary's Department paying for items to repair or construct a bake oven, et cetera
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Equipment and supplies; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Five sheets with printing on both sides, entitled "[Form 1.] Bill of Purchase--Commissary's Department. The State of Tennessee." The five bills of purchase deal with blacksmithing a bake oven door; use of labor of two boys, Ely and Lucien; the baking of bread; the purchase of onions and heads of cabbage. The charges range from $14.00 to nearly $82.00.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Commissary Department was in charge of all food or subsistence supplies at a military post. The storehouses used by the Assistant Commissaries of Subsistence were provided by the Quartermaster Department; many of the storehouses were leaky, dilapidated, and full of rats, making it difficult to guard the company's store of foodstuffs.
